required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Health Related Quality of Life Assessment In Egyptian Recipients After Living Donor Liver Transplantation

brief_summary.textblock: Health Related Quality of Life Assessment In Egyptian Recipients After Living Donor Liver Transplantation

detailed_description.textblock:
This Study Aims to Evaluate:-
1. Quality of life after LDLT In Egyptian patients using short form 36 (SF - 36) score.
2. Impact of post transplant medical and psychiatric complications on quality of life

primary_outcome.measure: Quality of life after LDLT In Egyptian patients using short form 36 (SF - 36) score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of post transplant medical and psychiatric complications on quality of life

arm_group.arm_group_label: Recipients of Living Donor Liver Transplantation
arm_group.description: Patients who will undergo Living Donor Liver Transplantation (LDLT) In Ain Shams Center For Organ Transplantation (ASCOT) .

study_pop.textblock: patients who will undergo LDLT In Ain Shams Center For Organ Transplantation (ASCOT) in the next 6 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult Egyptian patients
- 18-60 years old
- Patients transplanted for HCV related disease and /or HCC
- Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other etiologies for end stage liver disease (such as HBV and cholestatic liver disease and autoimmune hepatitis).

facility.name: Ain Shams Center For Organ Transplantation (ASCOT),Ain Shams university

responsible_party.investigator_title: Lecturer of tropical medicine , Ain Shams university
